intro: Galatella graminifolia, commonly known as the grassy galatella, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. Its small, white to greenish flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Galatella graminifolia is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
